name: Babel
description: Turn ES6+ code into vanilla ES5 with no runtime

name: Traceur compiler
description: ES6 features > ES5. Includes classes, generators, promises, destructuring patterns, default parameters & more.

name: es6ify
description: Traceur compiler wrapped as a Browserify v2 transform

name: babelify
description: Babel transpiler wrapped as a Browserify transform

name: es6-transpiler
description: ES6 > ES5. Includes classes, destructuring, default parameters, spread

name: Square's es6-module-transpiler
description: ES6 modules to AMD or CJS

name: Facebook's regenerator
description: transform ES6 yield/generator functions to ES5

name: Facebook's jstransform
description: A simple utility for pluggable JS syntax transforms. Comes with a small set of ES6 -> ES5 transforms

name: defs
description: ES6 block-scoped const and let variables to ES3 vars

name: es6_module_transpiler-rails
description: ES6 Modules in the Rails Asset Pipeline

name: Some Sweet.js macros that compile from ES6 to ES5
Bitovi's transpile
description: Converts ES6 to AMD, CJS, and StealJS.

name: regexpu — Transform Unicode-aware ES6 regular expressions to ES5
Lebab
description: Transformations for ES5 code to ES6 (approximates)

name: es6-transpiler: gulp-es6-transpiler
description: ES6 → ES5

name: es6-jstransform: gulp-jstransform
description: ES6 → ES5 using FB's jstransform

name: Babel: grunt-babel
description: Turn ES6+ code into vanilla ES5 with no runtime

name: Traceur: grunt-traceur ES6 > ES5 transpilation, grunt-traceur-build
Regenerator: grunt-regenerator
description: ES6 generator functions to ES5

name: grunt-microlib
description: tools for libs using ES6 module transpiler (sample Gruntfile)

name: grunt-defs
description: ES6 block scoped const and let variables, to ES3

name: es6-transpiler: grunt-es6-transpiler
description: ES6 → ES5

name: TypeScript: grunt-ts
description: ES6+ > ES5/ES3 transpilation

name: Scratch JS
description: A Chrome/Opera DevTools extension to run ES6 on a page with either Babel or Traceur

name: generator-typescript
description: Yeoman generator for TypeScript apps

name: Mocha Traceur
description: A simple plugin for Mocha to pass JS files through the Traceur compiler

name: ES6 Module Loader polyfill (compat with latest spec and Traceur)
js-loaders
description: Mozilla's spec-compliant loader prototype

name: JSPM
description: ES6, AMD, CJS module loading/package management

name: beck.js
description: toolkit for ES6 Module Loader pipelines, shim for legacy environments

name: es6-boilerplate
description: Tooling to allow the community to use es6 now via traceur in conjunction with amd and browser global modules, with source maps, concatenation, minification, compression, and unit testing in real browsers.

name: es6-jspm-gulp-boilerplate
description: Tooling to allow the community to use es6 now via babel in conjunction jspm, with source maps, concatenation, minification, compression, and unit testing in real browsers using es6.

name: generator-node-esnext
description: Yeoman generator for Traceur apps

name: generator-es6-babel
description: Yeoman generator for Babel apps

name: generator-gulp-babelify
description: Yeoman generator for Babel, Browserify and Gulp

name: grunt-init-es6
description: scaffold node modules with unit tests, authored in ES6

name: Loom generators with ES6 ember modules
Brunch plugin for ES6 module transpilation
core-js
description: Modular and compact polyfills for ES6 including Symbols, Map, Set, Iterators, Promises, setImmediate, Array generics, etc. The standard library used by Babel.

name: es6-shim
description: almost all new ES6 methods — from Map, Set, String, Array, Object, Object.is and more.

name: WeakMap, Map, Set, HashMap
description: ES6 Collections

name: es6-promise
description: polyfill for Promises matching the ES6 API

name: ES6 Map Shim
description: destructive shim that follows the latest specification as closely as possible.

name: harmony-reflect
description: ES6 reflection module (contains the Proxy API)

name: ES5 based shims in pure CJS style
description: Array, Object, Number, Math and String functions/methods, plus Map, Set, Symbol and WeakMap objects

name: ES6 syntax highlighting for Sublime Text and TextMate
ES6 syntax support in WebStorm and PhpStorm, compilation to ES5 with file watchers or task runners
Grammar and transpilation package  for Atom
Learn ES6 transpilation options in Webstorm Read Blog Post
Esprima
description: JavaScript parser supporting ES6, parses to ESTree AST format

name: Acorn
description: A small, fast, JavaScript-based JavaScript parser with ES6 support, parses to SpiderMonkey AST format.

name: esparse
description: ES6 parser written in ES6.

name: Traceur compiler also has built-in parser available under traceur.syntax.Parser.
ES.next showcase
description: real-world usage examples of ES6 features

name: looper
description: static analysis tools for ES6

name: es-dependency-graph and grunt-es-dependency-graph
description: Generate a list of imports and exports from ES6 module files, useful for preloading, bundling, etc.

name: es6-import-validate and grunt-es6-import-validate
description: validate matching named/default import statements in ES6 modules.

name: let-er
description: transpiles let-block block-scoping (not accepted into ES6) into either ES3 or ES6

name: Recast
description: Esprima-based JavaScript syntax tree transformer, conservative pretty-printer, and automatic source map generator. Used by several of the transpilers listed above, including regenerator and es6-arrow-function.

name: Paws on ES6
description: Minimalist examples of ES6 functionalities.

name: ES6 on node
description: How to use ES6 features in node.js.

name: es6-translate
description: Uses the ES6 loader hooks to load (node flavored) commonjs packages in ES6.

name: babel-node
description: Run node cli with ES6 transpiling using Babel.

name: ES6 Lab setup
description: A simple setup for transpiling ES6 to ES5 using Babel or traceur with gulp and jasmine support.

name: TypeScript
description: A superset of ECMAScript with strict typing that aims to align with ES6

name: Rollup
description: Rollup is a next-generation JavaScript module bundler. Author your app or library using ES2015 modules, then efficiently bundle them up into a single file for use in browsers and Node.js
